001package imagingbook.lib.math.eigen;
002
003import static org.apache.commons.math3.linear.CholeskyDecomposition.DEFAULT_ABSOLUTE_POSITIVITY_THRESHOLD;
004import static org.apache.commons.math3.linear.CholeskyDecomposition.DEFAULT_RELATIVE_SYMMETRY_THRESHOLD;
005
006import java.util.Arrays;
007
008import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.CholeskyDecomposition;
009import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.DecompositionSolver;
010import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.EigenDecomposition;
011import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.LUDecomposition;
012import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
013import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
014import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
015
016import imagingbook.lib.math.Matrix;
017
018/**
019 * Solver for generalized symmetric eigenproblems.
020 * @author WB
021 * @version 2021/11/11
022 */
023public class GeneralizedSymmetricEigenSolver {
024        
025        private final RealMatrix LiT;
026        private final EigenDecomposition ed;
027        
028        /**
029         * Solves the generalized symmetric eigenproblem of the form
030         *       A x = lambda B x,
031         * where matrices A, B are symmetric and B is positive definite.
032         * See Sec. 11.0.5. of Press, Teukolsky, Vetterling, Flannery. 
033         * "Numerical Recipes". Cambridge University Press, third ed. (2007).
034         * 
035         * An exception is thrown if A is not symmetric and
036         * the Cholesky decomposition throws an exception if B is not symmetric
037         * and positive definite.
038         * 
039         * @param A real symmetric matrix
040         * @param B real symmetric and positive definite matrix
041         * @param rsth  relative symmetry threshold
042         * @param apth absolute positivity threshold
043         */
044        public GeneralizedSymmetricEigenSolver(RealMatrix A, RealMatrix B, double rsth, double apth) {
045                if (!MatrixUtils.isSymmetric(A, rsth)) {
046                        throw new RuntimeException("matrix A must be symmetric");
047                }
048                final RealMatrix L = new CholeskyDecomposition(B, rsth, apth).getL();
049                final RealMatrix Li = MatrixUtils.inverse(L);
050                this.LiT = Li.transpose();
051                
052                final DecompositionSolver ds = new LUDecomposition(L).getSolver();
053                final RealMatrix Q = ds.solve(A);               // solve L * Q = A
054                final RealMatrix Y = ds.solve(Q.transpose()); // solve L * Y = Q^T
055                // alternatively:
056                //RealMatrix Y = Li.multiply(A).multiply(LiT);
057                
058                this.ed =  new EigenDecomposition(Y);
059        }
060        
061        /**
062         * See {@link #GeneralizedSymmetricEigenSolver(RealMatrix, RealMatrix, double, double)}.
063         * 
064         * @param A real symmetric matrix
065         * @param B real symmetric and positive definite matrix
066         */
067        public GeneralizedSymmetricEigenSolver(RealMatrix A, RealMatrix B) {
068                this(A, B, 
069                                DEFAULT_RELATIVE_SYMMETRY_THRESHOLD, 
070                                DEFAULT_ABSOLUTE_POSITIVITY_THRESHOLD);
071        }
072        
073        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
074        
075        public RealVector getEigenVector(int i) {
076                return LiT.operate(ed.getEigenvector(i));
077        }
078        
079        public double[] getRealEigenvalues() {
080                return ed.getRealEigenvalues();
081        }
082        
083        public double[] getImagEigenvalues() {
084                return ed.getImagEigenvalues();
085        }
086        
087        public boolean hasComplexEigenvalues() {
088                return ed.hasComplexEigenvalues();
089        }
090        
091        public RealMatrix getD() {
092                return ed.getD();
093        }
094
095        
096        public RealMatrix getV() {
097                return LiT.multiply(ed.getV());
098        }
099
100        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
101        
102        public static void main(String[] args) {
103                RealMatrix A = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(new double[][] {
104                        { 3,  -1,  5},
105                        { -1,  -2, 7},
106                        { 5,  7, 0}});
107                
108                RealMatrix B = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(new double[][] {
109                        { 10, 2,  7},
110                        {  2, 12, 3},
111                        {  7, 3, 15}});
112                
113                GeneralizedSymmetricEigenSolver decomp =
114                                new GeneralizedSymmetricEigenSolver(A, B);
115                
116                double[] evals = decomp.getRealEigenvalues();
117                System.out.println("evals = " + Arrays.toString(evals));
118                
119                RealMatrix V = decomp.getV();
120                System.out.println("V = \n" + Matrix.toString(V.getData()));
121                RealMatrix D = decomp.getD();
122                System.out.println("D = \n" + Matrix.toString(D.getData()));
123                
124                for (int i = 0; i < evals.length; i++) {
125                        double lambda = evals[i];
126                        RealVector evec = decomp.getEigenVector(i);
127                        System.out.println("evec = " + Arrays.toString(evec.toArray()));
128                        
129                        RealVector L = A.operate(evec);
130//                      System.out.println("L = "+ Arrays.toString(L.toArray()));
131                        RealVector R = B.operate(evec).mapMultiply(lambda);
132//                      System.out.println("R = "+ Arrays.toString(R.toArray()));
133                        RealVector res = L.subtract(R);
134                        //System.out.println("res = "+ Arrays.toString(res.toArray())); // L - R must be 0
135                        System.out.println("res = 0? "+  Matrix.isZero(res.toArray(), 1e-6));
136                        
137                        // check A*V = B*V*D
138                        RealMatrix AV = A.multiply(V);
139                        System.out.println("AV = \n" + Matrix.toString(AV.getData()));
140                        RealMatrix BVD = B.multiply(V).multiply(D);
141                        System.out.println("BVD = \n" + Matrix.toString(BVD.getData()));
142                }
143                
144        }
145}
